intro: Ilex maigualidensis, commonly known as the Maigualidensis holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes grown in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
